subject: Relationships
title: Marriage in Ancient Egypt
description: A micro-lesson that makes Marriage in Ancient Egypt usable.

hook.text: In ancient Egypt, women could own property, initiate divorce, and marry whoever they chose. 3,000 years ago.

buildup.text: Egyptian marriages required no religious ceremony. A couple simply moved in together and declared themselves married.

discovery.text: Prenuptial agreements existed in Egypt. Women listed assets they'd keep if the marriage dissolved.

twist.text: Egyptian women had more marital rights than women in many countries did until the 20th century.

climax.text: Ancient Egypt proves equality in marriage isn't a modern invention. Some civilizations figured it out millennia ago.

punchline.text: Egyptian women had divorce rights 3,000 years before most of the world.

quiz.question: What rights did women have in ancient Egyptian marriages?
options: Could own property, divorce, and choose their spouse
